Job Title: Fiber Optics Communications Superintendent - Solar/Fossil Fuel

Location: Minneapolis, MN

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
About The Role

The Fiber Optics Communication Superintendent is responsible for the development, implementation, installation, and testing of fiber optic networks, inclusive of selecting appropriate types of fiber, calculating loss budgets, and determining optimal routing and placement of fiber optic cables. The Superintendent is responsible for the performance of detailed site surveys to assess the feasibility of proposed fiber optic network installations, including physical terrain assessments and identification of potential obstacles, as well as the creation and interpretation of detailed network maps and schematics using GIS (Geographic Information Systems) and CAD (Computer-Aided Design) software, ensuring accurate representation of fiber routes and equipment locations.

Company Overview

At MYR Energy Services, a subsidiary of MYR Group Inc, our employees play an integral role in the company’s collective success. Our mission is to provide superior specialty contracting services by creating mutually rewarding relationships in a safe, inspiring, and open environment. We challenge our employees to possess uncommon determination meaning challenging the status quo and thriving in the adversity of construction.

Solar

MYRE is growing and working on renewable and solar energy projects throughout the U.S. Our growing team is both loyal and collaborative. We are committed to providing you with the tools and resources to support your growth as a valued employee and operate under a safety-first culture to ensure we all go home safe every day.

Essential Functions

Coordinate with construction teams and contractors during the installation phase, providing technical guidance and ensuring adherence to engineering specifications and safety standardsConduct thorough testing and commissioning of newly installed fiber optic systems, including OTDR (Optical Time-Domain Reflectometer) testing, power meter measurements, and end-to-end system performance verificationPerform detailed site surveys to assess the feasibility of proposed fiber optic network installations, including physical terrain assessments and identification of potential obstaclesTroubleshoot and resolve complex technical issues related to fiber optic networks, including signal degradation, connectivity problems, and equipment failures, employing advanced diagnostic tools and techniques.Research and evaluate emerging fiber optic technologies and materials, such as new types of optical fiber and advanced optical amplification techniques, for potential application in future network development projectsDevelop and provide weekly commissioning status report to the Testing & Commissioning ManagerConduct weekly coordination meetings with the Testing & Commissioning Manager, Electrical Superintendent and Field Commissioning SuperintendentParticipate, as needed, in project specific meetings such as kick-off meetings, sub-contractor meetings, and weekly progress and schedule update meetingsEnsure, through mentoring, training, and auditing, that Field Commissioning Superintendents, Electrical superintendents, and QA/QC representatives understand and apply the standards set forth in the Client project specific contract documentation, MYRE and OEM equipment supplier commissioning requirementsCoordinate with the Commissioning Operations Manager, Testing and Commissioning Manager and project manager as needed to collect required documentation for all major project milestones (MC, SC, EBF, SYNCH, COD, & project closeout)Ensure successful tests, including practice testing and the review and approve all commissioning test documentsCoordinate with the Testing and Commissioning Manager to build and complete the turnover documentationOther duties as assignedRegular and predictable attendanceEssential functions of this position are to be performed at a Company-designated office or field locationUnderstand and comply with the Company's Code of Business Conduct and Ethics Policy and other industry-specific professional and ethical standards


Qualifications

ABOUT YOU

Bachelor's degree in Construction Management, Mechanical, Civil or Electric Engineering or related discipline; combination of relevant education and experience considered in lieu of degreeBachelor's degree in fiber optic communications is preferredElectrical, telecommunications, or computer technology post-secondary education is preferredValid driver’s licenseHigh school diploma or GED3 years of supervisory experience is preferredMinimum 4 years of experience with commissioning activities on utility scale fossil fuel, and/or solar facilities, including SCADA/DAS system troubleshootingCertifications such as the BICSI Registered Telecommunications Project Manager (RTPM), Fiber Optic Technician (CFOT) by the Fiber Optic Association, and Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA) are beneficial for Fiber EngineersExperience with DCS, SCADA, fiber optic, CAT6, PLC, and MODBUS communications.Training certifications that can be accomplished within 90 days of employment:OSHA 30CPR/BLS/First AidNFPA 70E


Knowledge/Skills/Abilities

Industry certification and training is beneficialStrong analytical skillsDeep understanding of electronic and optical systems are essential.Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite. Excellent professional written and verbal communication skills.Advanced knowledge of NETA, NERC, IEEE, NFPA70E, and industry prudent workmanship and test requirements.Working knowledge of safety protocols, renewables/electric utility P&C systems (relaying, communication, networking, RTU, SCADA, CT, PT), and planned outage management processes.General knowledge of AC and DC electrical systems and electrical safety for systems up to 1500VDC and 230KV AC


What We Offer

Compensation & Benefits

Salary - $88,400 - $110,700 / year.Commensurate with experience, paid weekly. Posted salary ranges are made in good faith. MYR Group reserves the right to adjust ranges depending on the qualifications of the selected candidate. Comprehensive benefits package - Medical, Basic Vision, Regenexx, Teledoc, Hearing, Mental Health (Low deductibles and out-of-pocket maximums) - Fifteen Dollar weekly premium for employee or employee plus family coverage.Dental – 100% employer-paid premium.ThrivePass Health & Wellness Reimbursement Program - Twelve hundred dollars annually for health and wellbeing-related purchases.Annual Paid Time Off starting at 15 days plus 10 paid Holidays (Cultural Celebration Day is a floating holiday).Generous 401(k) Plan with 100% match up to 6%; immediate vesting, and Annual profit-sharing potential.Superior educational assistance program (support for educational costs, internal training, and more!).Company-paid short and long-term disability, life, and accidental death & dismemberment.Company-paid business travel accident insurance.Employee Assistance Plan (EAP).Various voluntary plans available including supplemental vision, accident and critical illness, ID theft, group legal, group auto & home, and additional voluntary life insurance plans for employees and dependents.

Position may be subject to pre-employment screening, which may include background check and drug testing. Accessibility: If you need an accommodation as part of the employment process, contact our Employment Hotline at 1-855-635-1321.

MYR Group, Inc. and our subsidiaries are proud to be Equal Opportunity Employers. We promote diversity of thought, culture, and background, which connects our family of brands. We are committed to a work environment that supports, inspires, and respects all individuals and in which personnel processes are merit-based and applied without discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age, disability, national or ethnic origin, military service status, or other protected characteristics. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

MYR Group does not sponsor applicants for work visas. Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States for any employer.

MYR Group, Inc. and our subsidiaries do not work with any third-party recruiters or agencies without a valid signed agreement and partnership with the Corporate Talent Acquisition Team.

Experience Level (if available): None
